content:
This is planned for tuesday June 16th right now, and currently I plan to include backports for rustfmt and cargo, notably:

  • https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/73078
  • https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/8335 (to 1.44 as well)
And bump backtrace-sys? (#71577 and maybe #71719)
yep, seems good. let's also cc @nikomatsakis and @pnkfelix on this

I guess there is some question about who all would exactly approve these backports -- they're all pretty outside of the "T-compiler" hat in some sense -- I guess we should stable-nominate a PR? I can try to have that up before Thursday's compiler meeting.
I'm going to bump the date here to thursday next week since we've not received a ton of testing and there's maybe a few more bugs that'll crop up on the relevant patches
are you planning to do a post about pre-release testing?
actually don't see one for 1.44.0 either, is that not being done anymore?
ah yeah I've been meaning to get one out
we had another backport come in last night (not yet merged) so I hesitated
maybe we'll end up skipping again not sure

@T-release would appreciate feedback on https://hackmd.io/icsdpWSwRF6CAcYzisDIeg?edit -- I didn't go line-by-line documenting each fixed regression, I don't personally see much point in doing so, but if people think we should then I can spend some time trying to put some text together
I think it would be good to list which tools are affected, but I agree that the specific regressions probably aren't that important to list.
I think it's all of them but rls?
I'll do so though
kicked off RCS for dev-static promotion of 1.44.1
I think everything is good to go for a release tomorrow which I'll kick off first thing I think
Thank you!
Okay, double checking artifacts but likely will kick off release in a few minutes
okay everything seems good to go, kicking off release
rcs invoked
tag pushed
thanks building https://travis-ci.com/github/rust-lang/thanks/builds/172037256
https://blog.rust-lang.org/2020/06/18/Rust.1.44.1.html
(deleted)
